verse.roman:
evaṁ yadūnāṁ śālvānāṁ
nighnatām itaretaram
yuddhaṁ tri-nava-rātraṁ tad
abhūt tumulam ulbaṇam

synonyms: evam—thus; yadūnām—of the Yadus; śālvānām—and the followers of Śālva; nighnatām—striking; itara-itaram—one another; yuddham—fight; tri—three times; nava—nine; rātram—for nights; tat—that; abhūt—was; tumulam—tumultuous; ulbaṇam—fearsome.
translation: As the Yadus and Śālva's followers thus went on attacking one another, the tumultuous, fearsome battle continued for twenty-seven days and nights.
